abstract: With an average of 24.6 million viewers, Fox’s “American Idol” dominated Wednesday night’s ratings, according to Nielsen’s estimates, as the singing competition narrowed its field of contestants to 24 semifinalists.
snippet: With an average of 24.6 million viewers, Fox’s “American Idol” dominated Wednesday night’s ratings, according to Nielsen’s estimates, as the singing competition narrowed its field of contestants to 24 semifinalists.
lead_paragraph: With an average of 24.6 million viewers, Fox’s “American Idol” dominated Wednesday night’s ratings, according to Nielsen’s estimates, as the singing competition narrowed its field of contestants to 24 semifinalists. Fox easily led the night over all, winning the 9 p.m. time slot after “American Idol” with its new game show “The Moment of Truth” (14.5 million).
